website_summaries.verdict: Good price for a handheld router. Offers variable speed control that's handy to have for some jobs.
pros: Features a 1.25 horsepower motor that's able to fulfill most woodworking needs at home
In some situations, can reach a speed of up to 30,000 revolutions per minute
Great design for a handheld router that makes it comfortable to use
One of the easier routers to set up and begin using quickly
cons: Not really made for heavy-duty workloads

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 14th router. I have several thousand hours experience using routers for all types of woodworking. I bought this because I was looking for a light weight router with more gumption than a laminate trimmer but something smaller than a full size router. Color me impressed. This kit has almost every possible base, guide, and attachment you could want. Very smooth operation. Well made machine, easily adjusted. Nice bag to keep things organized. I'm not usually a big fan of Makita, but this really blew me away.
customer_reviews.author: kamasutah

customer_reviews.title: RIP OFF - NO provision to use edge guide with plunge base without another purchase
customer_reviews.text: Formerly the plunge base included a nice little extra part that is mysteriously unavailable. This part enabled the use of the included straight guide or to just use the part itself as a guide. Now in order to use a straight guide with the plunge base you have to PURCHASE a straight guide which is junk for the money, (look at the Makita euro straight guides for the RT0701C, Makita Micro Adjustable Straight Guide Fence 193312-9 ) and you will realize the JUNK we are offered here. Alternatively you can purchase Rocky 30 plunge base which includes the mystery part shown in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Quickmill CremaMaster

customer_reviews.title: A good, medium power router that would serve most quite well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router setup if you need just medium power, versatility, and perhaps want only one unit. It is well made, the machining is tight, and adjustments are easy and accurate. I just finished routing 8 signs in fir with a hundred letters and edge work. I used mostly the plunge base...and achieved great, repeatable results. The motor never got hot nor did the router bog down when cutting full 1 inch quarter-round profiles in a single pass. Dust collection is decent...about what you'd expect with chips flying all over. Visibility of the cutting is good. Highly recommend this Makita router!! Looking forward to trying the other bases in time. -fixie
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I liked the router's features for the most part, BUT I have gripes with the rack-and-pinion "micro" adjustment. - You cannot adjust the depth without losing your current setting. - It's difficult to hold a selected depth setting while you press the clamp down. - Once clamped, the clamp does not hold tightly enough to prevent depth creep as you cut. Also note: My 1/4 inch radius roundover bit did not fit through the base plate. The hole is about 1/16" diameter too small.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Missing an Important Bracket for Plunger
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviewers have mentioned, the seller has decided exclude the small bracket that goes on the Plunger. Good luck finding it and if you do, please let me know. Otherwise, the tool is easy to use and seems well built. Hopefully Makita do something about the missing part in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Langan

customer_reviews.title: Speed control is dangerously defective
customer_reviews.text: Router speed control is dangerously defective. The dial is so loose that the motor spins itself up to maximum speed as soon as it's turned on.
customer_reviews.author: apurchaser

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Router with a Tiny Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a couple of routers before this one and by comparison this is compact and well crafted. It is easy to handle too. I took a star off because without a vacuum hose connection, wood dust collects behind the plastic shield, obscuring the view of the router bit. This forces one to remove the plastic shield which otherwise is in place for safety and controlling the flying wood dust. I still recommend this router. After all, the user should always wear personal protection equipment which includes safety glasses and a dust mask.
customer_reviews.author: cr

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the router today, a replacement for a Bosch router I bought back in the mid-1990’s which finally gave out. After I did a few test runs, I finished the two projects I had waiting on this tool then just kept routing every spare piece of wood I could find, testing out different bits and the different features of the kit. Absolutely love it, Makita has never let me down. The plunge base is a must-have, in my opinion. The router and all the accessories that came in the kit feel “hefty” and solid in the hand, and perform really well. Plenty of power to get through the walnut, cherry and ebony pieces I was working with.
customer_reviews.author: PilotJordan

customer_reviews.title: Regularly loses depth adjustment
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router about 2 years now. There are many good things about it. It's powerful, has soft start, and is well balanced and easy to use. The problem is you can't trust the depth adjustment. For each cut you need to check and re-adjust the depth or you will find it going deeper and deeper. I've tried tightening the collet and the adjustment clamp. It still does it. Each time I start to use it on a project, I have to decide whether I can use a router I can't trust.
customer_reviews.author: beardedone

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool... but it came rusted!
customer_reviews.text: First, I love this tool. The ease of use, the lower noise, the soft motor start, etc., all make this tool a winner. Works great! But it came with the spindle rusted, and the collet stuck inside because of the rust. The box did not look open, nor did the device look at all used. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Dogcat

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the 41st day of owning it.
customer_reviews.text: Had the router for 41 day and the metal housing cracked. I was trying to replace the router bit for the third time and the part that holds the pin broke. I own many festool dewalt and milwaukee products but my best friend recommend this router because of all of the features. If I have something new, when I buy most of my tools, break there is not question that it is garage. Save your money and buy a dewalt or festool router and not this twat waffle.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Engemann

customer_reviews.title: Another fine product from Makita
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little router. It is powerful and so much easier t handle as opposed to a larger router. Note that the Jasper 200J does fit the plunge base on this router.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight worker but quality control let downs
customer_reviews.text: Sent the first one back after the thread on the depth adjustment failed within 30 mins and would just spin free with the router vibrations. Replacement the sleeve was loose and had to be tightened before use. Doesn’t seem like Makita pays much attention to quality control. It’s a great lightweight router but the quality flaws from what is meant to be a great manufacturer earns this a 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Claytonie

customer_reviews.title: Makita. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.text: Been lusting after a router for several years, finally decided to pick one up. With a sharp bit this thing powers through soft woods without hesitation, I only ran into issues with some oak while making a cabinet door. Even a sharp bit put a load on the router that a larger unit would have handled better. However, I knew that it would have limitations going into the purchase so I was not surprised. Common sense, patience, and realistic expectations go a long ways! If it lasts half as long as my Makita sanders then it will have been money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: J.Wainscott

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great On 80% Receiver
customer_reviews.text: I got this router strictly to use with a kit to finish 80% receivers. It worked great! Plenty of smooth power, easy to change bits, easy to adjust. Pretty much a top-of-the-line product as you'd expect from Makita. I really like the "soft" start up feature...revs gently to speed instead of just slamming the power to the machine. The speed control keeps the speed constant even under load. It's just the right size, too. Easy to guide and handle. Great router.
customer_reviews.author: Carl STop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little router. Using it mainly for inlays (thus far). Easy to handle, though in plunge function, the on/off switch is a bit cumbersome to get at but not a deal-breaker. However, this did not earn 5 stars, mainly for one reason: There is a template guide for the regular base but not for the plunge. What???? Except for making dovetails, when does one need a template guide adapter for the regular base and not the plunge base??? Was not aware of that when purchased so, had to go order one so that I could use it for my inlay work. Back-asswards, IMHO!
customer_reviews.author: J. K. Miliunas

customer_reviews.title: No plunge base guide?
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of Makita tools and own several. However, as my first router, I assumed the “kit” -router, plunge base and guide - would allow me to fully utilize the device. Not so. The edge guide only works with the standard base. In order to use the plunge base for straight-line work, you have to purchase a separate edge guide for $45. That’s the same price as the plunge base, itself and about 1/3 the price of the entire kit ($139). What’s up with that, Makita? Is the plunge guide made of gold? All in all, it seems to be a well made and hefty tool, but seriously?
customer_reviews.author: rsk5150

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert or even an experienced person in wood working and wood working tools but i really love this router and so far it has completed all that I wanted .I love to do small wood working projects and this helps to make it enjoyable. As I said I am a bit of a novice handling power tools [although i worked in the Oil industry operating very large equipment] but I am quite comfortable with this router. Makes me feel like I can accomplish a lot with it.
customer_reviews.author: haroldjoe48

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this router kit w/plunge base. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router kit w/plunge base. I was looking for an Edge guide/fence for the plunge base that was more substantial than the guide that came with it. It turns out the Dewalt DW6913 works perfectly with the plunge base.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Worth the 3 months of research.
customer_reviews.text: My first router and first time using a router. Right out the box it was super easily to use. Good job Makita. Love Bosch drills, but their small router just didn't seem like it would work for me. Used to trim my formica for cabinet building and it was amazing. I felt like a professional buy the the 3rd pass. I'm glad I went with this set as it has all the attachments, the best the the dusk collection. It does a decent job when attached to my Ridge 5Hp shop vac. Well done Makita, well done.
customer_reviews.author: Nena

customer_reviews.title: Well made, pretty easy to use but a couple of inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy router to use and seems to be well made. But there are two things I don't like. First, it's hard to see what you're doing--gotta hold the tool in just the right position as there is a visual opening only on a small portion of one side. Second, the larger of the two wrenches included (to tighten/loosen the shaft when inserting bits) doesn't fit properly inside the housing, making it really hard to use. I had to grind it down to make it work easily. The rest I like.
customer_reviews.author: C & J

customer_reviews.title: If I could, I'd marry it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this router. I was worried when I bought it about only having a quarter inch collet, but I have not worries anymore. This router makes routing more fun for me. With my other routers without plunge basses, cutting precisely is really scary, especially when starting the router up inside a hole. But this makes it feel a bit safer as the bit retracts into the router with the plunge base when taken off the work piece. Really great router.
customer_reviews.author: Olaf Schmied

customer_reviews.title: Make Some Dust!
customer_reviews.text: Makita always builds quality tools and this little guy is no exception. I purchased this router primarily for the plunge function but it works great in our out of the plunge base. Very powerful and relatively quiet. Great for chamfered or rounded edges. The plunge base is great. It is set up to help you dial in the exact depth of your cuts. I have used it to route juice grooves in cutting boards and it performed very well. Love this router. The only sort of negative is the guide rail but I usually use jigs for precise cuts so it’s not a big deal. Very easy to change bits. Well lit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It has all the power you would expect from a tool of this cost and quality. It is small enough to do easy free hand work and enough power to longer deeper cuts, though if I were regularly doing long deep cuts I would go for a more powerful router or a table. My only issue is the window size is small; you have to take the base off in order to change bits, because the window is to small or the tools are to big to fit in the space. My Dremmel made fast work of grinding the wrench down to fit, and I might take some materiel off the base to make thing even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: No case
customer_reviews.text: Never had a router before so I can't tell you if this is a good one, but it works. Seems pretty well made and the plunge base seems well made as well. Gotta say I'm a little disappointed that they couldn't throw in a blow molded case for this since there is so much to keep track of.
customer_reviews.author: Rdvark

customer_reviews.title: router
customer_reviews.text: Went to use router for first time, after owning for five weeks and collet or shaft is bent . Router shakes so bad it is not even usable. Amazons warranty is up and makita said they might warranty it. Seems like product support should be better on a supposedly quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Delayne W.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This is my only router. It has done everything I have asked it to do so far. The plunge base is well constructed. Smooth plunge action and controls are easy to access. The soft-start feature is nice. It doesn't try to jerk out of your hand when switched on. With the fixed base it is very easy to control one-handed for round-overs and chamfers. The edge guide is functional but not very robust. It is easier and more sure to clamp on a straightedge.
customer_reviews.author: Al Richardson

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice compact router, but could be improved
customer_reviews.text: The router has a nice feel. The operations manual wasn't very good. The plunge base was the worst. My Bosch has a release lever that locks the base until released, and this one has a release lever that needs to be locked. The locking is not as positive as I would like. The depth setting is not as good to set, and the instructions for setting are not clear. The price was good, but I think I would have been better off to get a Bosch compact router that I am used to in my full size router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really solid little router
customer_reviews.text: This is a really solid little router. I bought this for use in my second home as I'm building some small pieces and needed a trim router for chamfers and roundovers. I also own the Dewalt 611 trim router and while I love the Dewalt, this one is so much smoother in the hand. There's practically zero vibration. I'm very impressed with the build quality and ease of use right out of the box. If/when my Dewalt I have t home bites the dust, I'd grab one of these to replace in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Abrams

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Almost only because it doesn't have an LED light, which would be very helpful. It works great though, and leaves a nice finish on aluminum, no need to do any filing or sanding. It spits chips at you, even with a vacuum hooked up, so wear eye protection. An apron would help too.
customer_reviews.author: Galt44

customer_reviews.title: Mikita got this one right!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best router I have ever owned or used. The bases switch out very easily so you can go from edge routing to plunge routing within a min or two. The selectable speed dial is truly fantastic! This feature allows you to get clean smooth cuts in deferent type of wood and prevents blow outs when doing fine detailed work. This router has plenty of power in a tiny package. If your looking to buy a router for either traditional work or plunge routing this is definitely the right tool for the job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Makes Me Look More Skilled Than I Am
customer_reviews.text: My first router so I don't have anything to compare to, but I am making pretty cuts. With the guides and general precision of the tool, I believe this tool makes my work look better than the amount of skill I actually have, so there is that. Have not used the plunge base, but I did see online a guided system using the plunge base and looked pretty bad aps. The guide works really well, although it not the easiest to adjust. Once you get used to it however, it works as intended. I compared the measurment markings on on the regular base to a Starrett combination square and they spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This should last a long time, well made.
customer_reviews.text: I needed another router to compliment my somewhat large plunge router, (which is now mounted to a router table). This one is small and easy to handle, and I have no complaints so far. Makita makes quality tools and this is no exception. The plunge base makes control easier on items that require it, and is easy to adjust, as is the router itself. All in all a purchase I am happy with
customer_reviews.author: SBKMike

customer_reviews.title: Great all around hand router
customer_reviews.text: This router set is really consists of several bases, which makes it very versatile. The user's guide are also very good. The variable speed dial is useful when you work with different wood densities. THe only con is that it get pretty hot when used on harder woods, so make sure to run several depths to avoid that or damaging the router bit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice router. Although I will use it on wood ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice router. Although I will use it on wood I bought it for the purpose of machineing 80% lowers. That is where the 4 stars come in. The depth of cut will not go the full range and left me short in the trigger houseing. So I had to loosen the collet and pull the bit out over several passes. Other than that, for the $, not bad.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Compact router
customer_reviews.text: Overall the router is great! The "soft start" feature is nice and the size and power is excellent. The plunge router base is good and easy to adjust the depth. One star off for not having good visibility of the cutter while doing freehand cuts. It could use either some LED lights inside the cutter housing or a second opening on the rear of the housing to give the operator a better view.
customer_reviews.author: RA Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool.
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great router. It's small and easy to hold and use but also has plenty of power. It comes with a variety of attachments, a few I'll likely not use often but it's nice to have them. These small routers are so much easier to use than the larger sized units so I find we use it more often even for quick and small jobs. Can't recommend it enough, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matt @ LookIntoHawaiiDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Compatibility with cordless and the answer
customer_reviews.text: The regular base that comes with this tool is exactly like cordless version and YES PLUNGE BASE WORKS WITH CORDLESS MAKITA ROUTER. I read 400 reviews of 4 people asking if this was the case( with only dumb answers is response). The other 396 questions proves people are morons.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Z

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I'm new at routers and this was a good start. Practiced on scrap wood before using to cut the inset for cabinet door panels. The fence was useful and it worked out well. Makes quite a mess so bought the inexpensive dust collector attachment for the next project.
customer_reviews.author: dscotrobin

customer_reviews.title: Misleading to label this as a kit
customer_reviews.text: Most people will by this "kit"instead of the stand alone router for the plunge base but in reality you must purchase additional items to use it, like a base insert, template bushings, and an additional edge guide to name a few. It should not be listed as a "kit"
customer_reviews.author: DannyBoy

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this kit years ago
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic router. Plenty of power, easy to handle, well balanced and simple to change bases and bits. I only wish they would have included a carry bag/case, but that doesn't bother me enough to ding my score. Nicely done Makita.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Finkel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - smooth - accurate - fun!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't totally sure what I'd think about these, since I was researching so many different routers - and most were more powerful routers. The moment I switched this on, the power up was smooth, the sound level was amazingly bearable, and routing with it was smooth and just... flat out fun! I made some in closet shelves with it, so I haven't been able to use all the attachments yet, but I've got plans for all those extra things!
customer_reviews.author: Everstar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for all levels of projects... no job too small or too big.
customer_reviews.text: This product is truly amazing!!!! Worth every penny!!! Small but super powerful. If you need to buy just one router for every wood project, that’s the one! In past few weeks I have put it through a ringer and it came out a champ every time. I even used it to flatten the slabs. FurnishingsByHand.com
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. I have a table router
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I have a table router, but needed a small hand-held one for trimming. This one is excellent. With soft start it is easy to control with one hand and it has enough power to trim 3/4" hardwood plywood with no problems. It is also relatively quiet as far as routers go.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Nazartsev

customer_reviews.title: Just push the buy now button
customer_reviews.text: I love this router! I have a larger 3.5hp router in a table but the kick when using it by hand is uncomfortable. This has soft start, super easy to use, I love that it includes the plunge base and you can buy all the other bases for it.
customer_reviews.author: lifeeverordinary

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat Makita quality!
customer_reviews.text: Labored over choice of compact routers, so happy I went with Makita! Soft start & auto speed not only keeps strain on my hands and wrists to almost nothing, keeps my cuts consistent and smooth. Router & plunge attachment are extremely well machined, which is something not found in many of the leading brands at this category/price point. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Moran Jr

customer_reviews.title: My first - always a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. I don't plan on using it all that much but it has already proven itself useful. I like the form factor very much. I'll update as I get more comfortable with it via more projects. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: a. Syverson

customer_reviews.title: Fixed slipping issues.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I was worried when the depth kept slipping on me. Then I noticed the little nut on the side of the locking lever. I tightened the nut 1/2 turn and that solved it. No more slipping up and down with preassure. Great router for its size.
customer_reviews.author: CasaDeArty

customer_reviews.title: Enough power for its small size
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit. More than enough power to plunge 3/4" bit to 1/4" depth without bogging down in hardwood. Small and comfortable to operate. Accurate depth stops on plunge base make routing long dadoes a breeze. Much faster than setting up a stack dado blade. Great tool with Amazon's fast and hassle free purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Ed Rakowsky

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Great price.  Thank you Makita
customer_reviews.text: Makita doesn't make cheap tools so I don't know how this great kit is so affordable. I wanted the cordless kit but this is a great router kit so I got this and the cordless router separately. If you don't already have the batteries, maybe don't do that. If you just want a fantastic kit, this is it
customer_reviews.author: steve carlson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Great little router. I use it on a CNC router table and it is a perfect fit for that application. I had read that it can get hot, but have never experienced that. I've used it on CNC fobs that took three hours of continuous running to complete and was never more that moderatly warm. The only issue I have encountered is that I can not find an eighth inch collet for this router, so can only use my quarter inch mills.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie R Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Issues with height adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: Its a great tool by itself without other jigs. I have issue with height adjustment as it changes during the work and needs several adjustment. the small round surface makes it hard to keep it flat on the small works.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan F

customer_reviews.title: To weak. Sorry.
customer_reviews.text: Wrong choice for plunge function operation. To weak, not steady. Can be used for inlay maybe, but definitely not for groove cutting even if the groove not deep. 3/8" deep cutting of poplar killed the brushes after 7 lines
customer_reviews.author: yuri rayzberg

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out tool
customer_reviews.text: I have put this to use several times since I purchased it. The depth has been easy to adjust, the parts are well machined, and the storage case is beyond what I expected. I was just going to get the router and get the extra add-ons later. I am glad I got this all together as I have already used most of the add-ons.
customer_reviews.author: avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Nimble and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I used this to trim some laminate I glued to a desk top. There was even a section that was mitered at 45 degrees. This tool made the job a piece of cake. If you're reading this and considering purchasing, do yourself a favor and get it. You won't regret it. It's one of the best routers I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Nick M.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice light router kit. Good value for the price. I use it for inlays. The plunge stop handle could be improved. It has to be pushed hard to lock the plunge base in the down position and that is hard to do without moving the router and damaging the inlay.
customer_reviews.author: Andras L

customer_reviews.title: Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: When I push this router it seems like its very hard to slide on the wood. Maybe its the plastic used on the base? I have a larger router that I use and I thought this would be easier on the wrist to hold. But I find myself having to use more pressure to get it to slide along. Its not even really an improvement when its actually in use. Ive used the Bosch router similar to this and I think it is better.
customer_reviews.author: mjdny1173

customer_reviews.title: Flawless.
customer_reviews.text: Runs like a champ. The speed (RPM's) has a good range and the motor seems to purr (it whines, actually). Quality all around, even the cord it a notch above. It gets a little hot after running for 30-40 minutes of straight cutting, so I would not rely on it for big, long-term contractor work. I have about 5 hours on this thing so far and will update if it lets me down in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Senoralitha

customer_reviews.title: Makita bigot alert!
customer_reviews.text: Compact yet feature packed router. I admit I’m kinda a Mikita bigot but I’m cheap too so I tried to get away with harbor freight and even eBay models and was terribly disappointed. So then when it came to spending the money I ponied up the cash and went back to Makita. Lesson learned
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: This router is incredible. It is for smaller jobs. Not for jobs that the big routers are used for but is does an outstanding job. It works great for teaching kids woodworking. This router gets the small tight corners also. The extra attachments are a great bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy Hedges

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This a small but powerful router. it was many features and attachments that are perfect for any job. if you are a beginner or pro, this will definitely work! I researched buying one for a while and I chose this one. Its your best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Makita RT0701CX3 1-1/4 HP Compact Router Kit for Quality Custom Routing
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality corded Compact Router with multiple bases to meet those demanding customized routing tasks. While I haven't had the opportunity to use all the base options, I liked that all the bases were compatible with the Makita cordless Compact Router. The vacuum hose attachments are also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Doug in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: I wished that i saw the newest deal with the plunge router base. But this is the ticket if you only need it for small projects. It handles well with the adjustable speeds and work well in tight areas.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Cool Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Got the whole smash (after pricing them individually it was cheaper to buy the kit). I love it! I'm not doing heavy duty routing and this is absolutely perfect for crafters. My first project involved beveling and grooving molding for a custom floor transition. I enjoyed the versatility and compact size. So easy to use. I look forward to finding other creative uses for this router set.
customer_reviews.author: BC/DC

customer_reviews.title: What a nice router and nice price
customer_reviews.text: Throw your colt away. Or sell it !!! What a nice router and nice price!!! I had alot of tools stolen, mostly Milwaukee. Makita has been my replacement for most. Really liking the switch! Less $$ same results. I am a finish carpenter.
customer_reviews.author: js

customer_reviews.title: Edge Guide Not Compatible with Plunge Router Base
customer_reviews.text: The edge guide only works with the fixed base. The plunge router base does not work with it because Makita didn't include the mounting bracket. I bought the Dewalt DW6913 and I'm hoping that will work.
customer_reviews.author: bcounts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this little makita router. Great size and power for the size, plunge base makes it extremely versatile. I have already added another corded makita tool to my shop after being so pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Bloq

customer_reviews.title: Works for me, and isn't that what's really important?  (for me?)
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I'm not a professional, and only use it occasionally but it's much smaller than my old router and easier to control. I was able to trace out a oval piece I had and make a perfect fit in a 2x2 board to create a sturdy birdhouse stand. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: William Parish

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this router to make the grooves for door hinges. It handled that task flawlessly. It's a nice compact router that will get several future uses on other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Catch

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: I've had a chance to use it and I like the portability over my larger router that I now keep in my router table. Mine did have a flaw in that the speed adjustment dial was loose and would move on it's own during routing and the speed would change. Sent it back and got a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kuhltool

customer_reviews.title: It's Makita, that's really all you need to know.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this little beast a TON since I got it a few months back. It has a bunch of power, soft start (which is amazing) and I got the one with the plunge base included. It is a professional tool and if you're looking for a powerful, lightweight and easy to control palm router, well... This is it. Would buy it again if I ever managed to break it
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: My first router
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last year to put some edges on wood projects around the house as I continue to renovate the house, room by room. I suspect my wife wishes I would pick up the pace a little, but these things take time. I have a ways to go before I decide that I need more attachments. This along with a good set of router bits is an excellent way to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Dan JTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Makita RT0701CX7 - Plunge Router
customer_reviews.text: I researched for several weeks and finally made the decision to buy the Mikita. Could not be happier with the choice. It's reliable, comfortable and powerful enough to do any DIY project you may need it for. Adding the plunge base is quick and easy, allowing for very accurate adjustments and fine tunning. My only complaint is the time it takes to install the edge guide rail. All around, a much better product than anything else in this price range. Highly recommend for your average DIY'r.
customer_reviews.author: JT's Wood Working & Design

customer_reviews.title: Keep it clean!!
customer_reviews.text: Great first router, but make sure to keep it clean!! I wasn't fully cleaning it after each use and the mechanisms started to stick. I had to send it into Makita for a full cleaning and now I use an air blower after each use to keep it clean. Plunge router was a must for me
customer_reviews.author: Mth44

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Husband is very happy with this router. He removed the center panels on kitchen cabinet doors to replace solid panels with glass, and is pleased with the ease of use and excellent results. His honey-do list is growing!
customer_reviews.author: Booklover

customer_reviews.title: Extremely manageable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a do it yourself home owner and purchased this unit to work one new interior doors hinge routing. Very powerful, compact and easy to use. High quality unit and makes the work fun.
customer_reviews.author: George F.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Lightweight Router
customer_reviews.text: Comfy in the hand, easy to adjust router depth, WELL BUILT. Getting me through a couple cabinet projects around the house and making building them so much faster and easier.
customer_reviews.author: MacKilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Horrible packaging. Glad it still worked.
customer_reviews.text: It works, thank God! It was packaged so horribly. I'm glad I was home. Cus it looked like I just left my tool outside. It was just in it's regular Makita box with a label slapped onto it. Part of it was protruding out of the side of the box. Please ship packages at least double boxed with any kind of protection from bouncing around. I don't care if it's newspaper. Something.
customer_reviews.author: sabrina heaton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use little router
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little router for the projects I do. Because its trim router I had no luck finding a router table for it, built one and it has handled everything I've thrown at it so far. Bag it comes with as plenty of space for the bases it comes with plus much more. Everything I expected from Makita.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse H.

customer_reviews.title: THE bomb for 80% lower milling.
customer_reviews.text: I use a Modulus Arms Heavy Duty Universal AR15 jig on aluminum and polymer lowers alike, and this router is the perfect companion to the drill press. Strong, adjustable, well built.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyMikeMB

customer_reviews.title: Amateur guy
customer_reviews.text: This thing does NOT bog down, does get hot, but it was chewing 3/4" wide channels 1/4" deep with no issues in poplar and plywood. I'm an amateur so I'm not the expert, but I didn't feel like I was compromising on my project with this small router.
customer_reviews.author: J Hunt

customer_reviews.title: trim router with plunge adapter
customer_reviews.text: sweet tools. Easily flips from standard base to plunge. Lots of neat extras. Lots of power, slow starts and speed adjust nice features. If you want a trim router, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: John kosher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product for sometime now and have found it to be one of my favorite routers to use. It's easy to use and powerful enough for any job I have used it on. The feel of this router is sturdy and well made. a joy to use. Would definitely but again.
customer_reviews.author: David F. Hays

customer_reviews.title: well made and great router that is light and easy to control
customer_reviews.text: great tool.router bit removal and exchange is not perfectly easy but is pretty much the same with all routers. the height adjustment is perfect and accurate. i have not been using any of the guides and have been freehanding only. plenty of torque from the electric motor.
customer_reviews.author: rick limbird

customer_reviews.title: Best router I own!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at the power this little router generates and it's compact size makes it very easy to use. Haven't used my old large size router in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M. Murakami

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Makita fan for years until I purchased this product. Did not come with any collet wrenches. Collet won't stay tight. Bit comes loose and damaged wood beyond use. I tightened collet until I was afraid collet lock was going to break. Also depth adjustment won't lock good. I had to tighten nut on lever lock until now I can barely operate lever.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry F. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trim Router
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built . Runs smooth at all speeds. Plunge base makes this kit a real useful tool for repetitive operations and template work.
customer_reviews.author: William  Rome

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Did not really work for us. We could not fit the larger 1/4 bits. It was unstable. I feel bad writting a bad review, but it just didn't work for me. If I ever get another router I would get 1/2 inch.
customer_reviews.author: J-rod

customer_reviews.title: Great Routing Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is great for preparing wood for butterflies. and hand routing of table edges.
customer_reviews.author: Official

customer_reviews.title: just love it and used the old one for rough work
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my old Sears router for 40 years and took on a project of installing butcher block counter tops and decided having a spare router would be handy. It turned out that this is the goto router for the job, just love it and used the old one for rough work.
customer_reviews.author: Ebookit

customer_reviews.title: nice machine, fits my hand better that the Bosch Colt router
customer_reviews.text: this router fits my hand like it was supposed to be there, but they didn't think to put in a light like Dewalt did on their comparable router. But I like the way it feels in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: john bliven

customer_reviews.title: There’s no LED light
customer_reviews.text: The tool kicks butt it’s very easy on the vibration and fits nicely in ur hands, so long as u don’t have hobbit hands. My use was for doing AR lowers which it just ate thru the 6065 aluminum and the 7075 aluminum. The only thing I have a issue it’s it and it’s a buggy that there’s no FREAKING LIGHT WTF !! Lol anyways other than it’s a good buy but the light is important. Makita should add one
customer_reviews.author: Paul Soltero

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased March 2020 and died today after only light use over the last few months.
customer_reviews.author: MetalMommy

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for my uses
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and adjust. I liked the geared adjustment and snap locks accurate and easy to adjust and lock down depth for cuts. I used it to do some light weight milling of Aluminum blanks worked great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not an industrial router, great for small projects where you need maneuverability.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said this router gets hot. But what a sweet thing it is. The small size makes it quite versatile. Not for big jobs, I have others routers for that purpose. The maneuverability is excellent. I used this router to inset my Rockler Router table into the router work station I am building. Saved me a lot of time. Was great for the radius cuts and the laminate work.
customer_reviews.author: Roland O Begin

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting more from Makita. Connections/joints could be smoother and tighter. The edge guide isn't solid, even when fully tightened.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great little router for those smaller jobs. Its the quality you'd expect from Makita.
customer_reviews.author: Jett

customer_reviews.title: Burned up in normal use.
customer_reviews.text: After 3rd use motor popped and started smoking. Was surface clearing at 1/4 inch depth passes, 1 foot square when it slowed quickly and popped then started smoking.
customer_reviews.author: HandsomeHal

customer_reviews.title: It works great and there's not a thing wrong with it
customer_reviews.text: What can you say? It's a Makita. It works great and there's not a thing wrong with it. An LED worklight would be a nice addition to the next generation of this model.
customer_reviews.author: D. Skowron

customer_reviews.title: Not for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: A handy machine. Takes getting used to but when one has practiced it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

product_meta.title: Makita RT0701C 1-1/4 HP Compact Router
product_meta.description: Style:Tool1-1/4 HP motor delivers 6.5 Amps for improved performance. Heavy Duty aluminum motor for increased durability.
feature_bullets: Variable speed control dial (10,000 to 30,000 RPM) enables user to match the speed to the application
Smooth rack and pinion fine depth adjustment system for more precise settings
Slim and ergonomically designed body for increased comfort and control
Quick release cam lock system for easy depth adjustments and base removal/installation
Electronic speed control maintains constant speed under load
Soft start feature for smooth start ups
Fixed base accepts industry standard template guides for convenience
High visibility base design for improved handling and performance
Base can be removed quickly to install other bases
Heavy duty aluminum motor housing engineered for increased durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,249 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
